conclusion: A drives in towards several groups of blocks of different colors.
A is positioned at the bottom-right, moving toward the upper-left.
There are blocks of different colors: red, purple, yellow, blue, and green.
A's initial direction brings it into first contact with the red block.
The red block is pushed aside with only a small deflection of A.
A continues roughly on the same diagonal path after hitting the red block.
A strikes the purple block almost head-on.
The larger mass/height of the purple block finally stops A's forward motion.
No other blocks (yellow, blue, green) are touched because the earlier deflection steers A slightly above them.
Blocks hit: red first, then purple (final stop).
A's final position is right up against the purple block, facing slightly left/upward.
